forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 44. Northeast wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Thanksgiving Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. Northeast wind around 9 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this early morning, the air carries a crisp clarity that is both inviting and invigorating. As the city begins to stir, the temperatures hold a chilly embrace around 44 degrees, with a gentle northeast breeze adding to the sense of freshness. The sky overhead is a wide expanse of clear blue, a promise of the sun that will soon rise and warm the surroundings. Not a trace of fog obscures the iconic skyline or the Golden Gate Bridge; instead, the horizon is painted with the vivid remnants of night transitioning to day. 

As Thanksgiving Day unfolds, you can expect the pleasant sun to rise high, bringing temperatures to a comfortable 58 degrees, which will gradually drop towards the afternoon. Dress warmly with layers, a light sweater or jacket as the breeze may still carry a hint of chill, especially near the bay. With the bright and clear weather, this day invites leisurely strolls along the waterfront or a visit to one of the city’s charming parks, perhaps chasing down the perfect cup of coffee at a local café. The clarity of the day beckons to enjoy the beauty of San Francisco, whether it be through a casual outing or a moment of quiet reflection amidst its vibrant urban rhythm.
